title: Kate Garraway admits I’m a Celebrity would be ‘horrific’
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Kate Garraway has refused to confirm whether she’s signed up for the next series of I’m a Celebrity, but she does admit the experience would be ‘horrific’.

The Good Morning Britain host was reportedly ‘confirmed’ to have joined the line-up for this year’s series of the hit ITV show and was receiving an eye-watering salary.

But on Monday, Kate was very coy about the reports and avoided confirming the news while co-hosting today’s GMB with Ben Shephard and Charlotte Hawkins.

After being pressed by her co-hosts, the presenter said: ‘Even if I was doing it, I won’t be able to say I’m doing it. And even if I wasn’t doing it, I can’t say I’m not doing it.’

When Ben asked if she’s ‘had a conversation’ about it, Kate replied: ‘It would be horrific. I don’t like heights, I don’t like the dark. I don’t like camping.

‘That is a good point actually, you can’t make a mess in the jungle because it’s already nature. I couldn’t be tidy in the jungle.’

She added jokingly: ‘There’s nothing about the show I’d be good at.’

Ben was desperate to know if his co-host had signed up (Picture: ITV)

While she wouldn’t give a firm answer, Kate did admit that her young children – Darcy, 13, and William, 10 – would be thrilled to see their mum in the Australian jungle.

‘Actually, that bit I can confirm is true, they would love me to do it,’ she revealed.

It comes after reports from The Sun that the 52-year-old presenter had been approached to do I’m a Celeb again after she was allegedly forced to pull out from talks for last year’s series.

At the time, it was claimed producers had offered Kate a cool £150,000.

According to The Sun, Kate has booked off time from work next month to start the show.

However, an ITV representative told Metro.co.uk that the reports are simply ‘speculation’ right now and a full line-up will be revealed closer to transmission.
